blog.name: thedemonphanti
blog.title: thedemonphanti
blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: But when dan said in that liveshow"i'm definitly not stopping youtube"(or something very similar to this) he looked really...
question: But when dan said in that liveshow"i'm definitly not stopping youtube"(or something very similar to this) he looked really honest and determined and he also tweeted that he is waiting for his"aesthetic"to be ready which i belive to be his background so all of that make it seems like he is just really on a hiatus to think about how to come back as his real self on youtube and make video for himself that he likes not for "fanservice" or what the fan wants?Much like "giving the people what i want"
answer: He could still come back to YouTube. I don’t think that’s out of the question at all. I have no idea what his thoughts are on it at the moment as it’s been quite a while since he shared anything more than three words at a time on the issue. I don’t think things will just resume as they were a year ago though, which some people seem to be holding out for, and I think that is just a recipe for disaster. If Dan does come back and make a video and people get mad at him for having changed and grown, I don’t think he will stick it out as he has done in the past. YouTube isn’t as lucrative as it once was, it’s less of a community, and he clearly isn’t getting the type of creative fulfillment he once was either. When people love their jobs, they want to do them. If he was satisfied with the relationship he has with his fanbase, he would want to interact, not just publish a tweet from his drafts when Phil needs to promote some merch or a video or to assure people he’s not dead. I don’t think Dan’s purposely lying to anyone by the way, even if in the end he does quit YouTube. I think he’s just trying to figure out how to feel fulfilled and create healthy boundaries and where YouTube fits into his life now. He said in ttlmt and in the mukbang videos that what he wants is changing from day to day. I’m personally starting to get bored waiting for him to figure it out, but whenever he does, even if I step away in the mean time, I’m sure I’ll check out anything that he does that is for public consumption. Even if Dan does something in the future which is different from what he has done in the past, that isn’t necessarily a bad thing. People grow and change and that’s a part of life. Sometimes doors have to shut for others to open.

blog.name: thedemonphanti
blog.title: thedemonphanti
blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: If I were Dan, I would be regretting the decision of becoming a YouTuber for the rest of my life. He should just quit. Go back...
question: If I were Dan, I would be regretting the decision of becoming a YouTuber for the rest of my life. He should just quit. Go back to uni or do whatever he can to make all this "Phandom" forget about him. But he can't, can he? Because people are so emotionally attached to him, that they could actually hurt themselves. And he seems to be painfully aware of that. Not to mention that Phil's career kinda depends on Dan. It's a horrible situation to be in.
answer: I don’t think Dan regrets his time being a YouTuber, at least I’ve never heard him express that. He has had so many opportunities open up to him as a result, including his ability to take this long period of time off to find himself. If he decides not to want to continue with YouTube, he has that option. Yes, in addition to the changes he would have to make personally as a result, it would effect Phil and his fans, but ultimately he has to live his life for himself, not for others and, as much as I miss his content, I am happy for him that he seems to realize this. Having to make difficult decisions that effect the people around you is unfortunately just a normal part of life and being an adult. Business partners go their separate ways all the time. Bands break up. People quit jobs and move on to new things. Family and friends move away from each other. We don’t really know what he is feeling or what he is going to end up doing career-wise and that is hard for a lot of people to cope with, but I do definitely agree very strongly that it isn’t alright for anyone to put the responsibility for their mental health on Dan. He is an entertainer, not a therapist, and anyone threatening to harm themselves if he doesn’t give into their desires is being manipulative and that’s not cool.

tags: i know ive been extremely absent recently
i mean for like the last year or so i guess ive been less active
but right now my family is going through a really tough time
and right now im just not feeling up to running this blog
ill be on it from time to time but i just feel like..
dnp were such a good part of my life
they helped me through a lot
and i dont want ppl to think i care less for them..
im just don't have the emotional capacity for it right now
so here is a gif set
it might be my last one for a while..
i just didn't want to make a post abt me leaving
so instead u get gifs and some tags
i hope youre all doing well<3
